com.nttdocomo.ui
Interface MediaPresenter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AudioPresenter, VisualPresenter
public interface MediaPresenter

This defines the reusable objects of media resource data. This media reusable interface regulates the interface that must be possessed by the media data presenting object.
The playing class determines the media data content and plays it. The type of media data that can be played is implementation dependent. The behavior when media data is set that cannot be played by UEs is implementation dependent and a UIException shall be generated in some case of implementation.

Method Summary
 MediaResource getMediaResource()
          This obtains the currently set media resource.
 void play()
          This starts playing media data.
 void setAttribute(int attrib, int value)
          This sets the attributes of the playing method.
 void setData(MediaData data)
          This sets the media data.
 void setMediaListener(MediaListener listener)
          This sets the listener.
 void stop()
          This stops playing of the media data.
 

Method Detail

setData

public void setData(MediaData data)
This sets the media data.

Parameters:
data - Designates the media data.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - Generated when the UE does not support this method.
UIException - Generated when this method is called during paying (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when "null" is designated for the argument data.
UIException - Generated when media data that cannot be played by UEs is designated for the argument data.(UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT)

getMediaResource

public MediaResource getMediaResource()
This obtains the currently set media resource.

Returns:
This returns a media resource. When the resource is not set, null shall be returned.

play

public void play()
This starts playing media data. It automatically stops playing when it has played the data until the end.

stop

public void stop()
This stops playing of the media data. When the stop method is called when playing is actually stopped, this method does nothing.

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(int attrib,
                         int value)
This sets the attributes of the playing method.

Parameters:
attrib - Designates the type of attributes to be set.
value - Designates the values of attributes to be set.

setMediaListener

public void setMediaListener(MediaListener listener)
This sets the listener. Only one listener can be registered as the presenter. When this method is called several times, only the listener registered last is valid. When null is designated as the listener object, the listener registration is deleted.

Parameters:
listener - Designates the listener to be registered.
